explanation: Agent A is correct given the provided configuration. With LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) defined as ((void)cfg) the expression statement in lfs_file_tell is executed but has no effect — removing it would not change program behaviour — which fits MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (dead code). The same applies to the LFS_LOCK macro here (it expands to a no-op returning 0), so the lock/unlock pair in this build are effectively dead. Caveat: if cfg has volatile semantics or if another build configuration defines LFS_UNLOCK to perform a real side‑effecting unlock, then the statement is not dead. Based on the supplied macro definitions and configuration, the report is correct.
